headline: Walmart, PayPal shareholders reject DEI overhauls as corporate America continues retreat from social issues
summary: Stockholders at Walmart and PayPal  on Thursday voted down proposals that would have upended how those companies deal with diversity, equity, and inclusion.

headline: Amazon Prime’s VP knows you’re sharing accounts—but for now he’s holding off a Netflix-style crackdown
summary: Amazon Prime's vice president Jamil Ghani told Fortune in an exclusive interview: "Our membership is different to a lot of others in that it is purposely meant for household individuals living together."

headline: Could Netflix Stock Help You Retire a Millionaire?
summary: Benefiting from the rise of the internet, Netflix achieved rapid growth, with 302 million subscribers (as of 2024) and a presence in 190 countries.  Management has implemented strategic pivots to continue expanding and capturing Netflix’s opportunity.  Netflix stock has made early investors wealthy, but the future could look different.

headline: If I Could Only Buy and Hold a Single Stock, This Would Be It
summary: Netflix management wants to double its revenue and market cap by 2030.  The company remains the king of the streaming service stocks.  Indeed, experts agree: It's best to own a diversified portfolio of stocks to insulate yourself from market volatility and the pitfalls that any company -- even the great ones -- experience from time to time.
